abstract: In this paper, we show that every (2n-1 + 1)-vertex induced subgraph of the n-dimensional cube graph has maximum degree at least n. This is the best possible result, and it improves a logarithmic lower bound shown by Chung, FÃ¼redi, Graham and Seymour in 1988. As a direct consequence, we prove that the sensitivity and degree of a boolean function are polynomially related, solving an outstanding foundational problem in theoretical computer science, the Sensitivity Conjecture of Nisan and Szegedy.
